thread.title: GE CDF Sees Strong Powersports Industry Growth
thread.title_full: GE CDF Sees Strong Powersports Industry Growth

title: GE CDF Sees Strong Powersports Industry Growth
text:
GE CDF Sees Strong Powersports Industry Growth July 29, 2015, 07:07 AM Related: Dealer Finance , Ge Capital , GE Capital Commercial Distribution Finance , General Electric Capital , Inventory Finance , Motorsports 
The powersports industry, which includes motorcycles, all-terrain vehicles (ATV), utility-terrain vehicles (UTVs), snowmobiles, and personal watercraft, is robust and continues to grow according to dealer performance data from Commercial Distribution Finance (CDF), a division of GE Capital. CDF dealer financing volume is up 12% through June, indicating dealers are ordering more product to meet increasing consumer demand. Dealer inventory turnover is running at a strong annual rate of over 2X, and aged inventory over 18 months old, is also healthy at under 6% of total portfolio. “Industry growth is coming from a steadily improving economy and from innovative product offerings from our manufacturing partners, attracting new riders,” said Jeremy Jansen, president of CDF’s motorsports group. “Also, dealers are doing a great job of balancing the right amount of inventory for the increase in demand.” Today's Other News
